item.title: Prior Art
item.description: The Problem Sometimes there is the “right way” and other times there is “how it is done in the codebase”. I would argue that a majority of the time the “right way” is the “how it is done in the codebase”. This might seem surprising, but generally I think consistency is incredibly important in a codebase. So while at first glance a practice might not be the accepted best practice, you shouldn’t change the codebase unless you can change everything over to the best practice.
